Intervention: Upper Extremity Lymphatic Mapping for Breast Cancer Patients

Patients with documented axillary metastases (Stage II breast cancer) will undergo subdermal injection of technetium sulfur colloid (TSC) into the ipsilateral upper extremity approximately 3 hours before surgery.
Eligibility: Females with Stage II invasive breast cancer and documented axillary metastases by core biopsy, clinical examination, or fine-needle aspiration who are scheduled to undergo an ALND.
History of ipsilateral upper extremity lymphedema
Prior history of surgical excision of the upper outer quadrant of the ipsilateral breast
Prior history of neoadjuvant chemotherapy for current breast cancer
Results: Number and Prevalence of Metastases of Blue Nodes in the ALND Specimen (Nodes Draining the Breast).
Arm/Group Title: Upper Extremity Lymphatic Mapping for Breast Cancer Patients

Arm/Group Description: Patients with documented axillary metastases (Stage II breast cancer) will undergo subdermal injection of technetium sulfur colloid (TSC) into the ipsilateral upper extremity approximately 3 hours before surgery.
